page.title: 03 CONSERVATION IN WHITLEY BAY
page.content: North Tyneside Metropolitan Council Recreation and Ameneties Department are actively trying to preserve and improve areas of local interest.There are three main localities where CONSERVATION is taking place.HOLYWELL DENE,the COASTAL AREA between CurryÂ£s Point and Hartley and BRIER DENE. HOLYWELL DENE is a steep-sided valley with a small stream running through it and is surrounded by deciduous woodland The COASTAL AREA is composed of sand- stone cliffs topped with boulder clay and grass. BRIER DENE is a steep sided V shaped valley with a small stream. Groups of young people are employed in the 3 CONSERVATION AREAS to develop nature trails,construct footpaths,clear rivers,prevent erosion,encourage the growth of wild flowers and animals and generally conserve these habitats.
